meanings.definition: To throw or toss something upward.
meanings.sent1: She upflinged the ball into the air.
meanings.sent2: He always upflings his hat when he's happy.
meanings.sent3: The magician upflinged the scarf, making it disappear in the air.
meanings.sent4: The wind upflinging the leaves created a beautiful dance in the sky.
meanings.sent5: With a swift motion, she upflinged the paper airplane into the blue sky.

meanings.definition: The act of lifting or raising something quickly.
meanings.sent1: The sudden upflinging of the curtain startled the cat.
meanings.sent2: His upflinging of the heavy box impressed everyone with his strength.
meanings.sent3: The upflinging of confetti at the party added a festive touch to the celebration.
meanings.sent4: The upflinging of the flag symbolized the start of the race.
meanings.sent5: The upflinging of the trophy marked the end of the competition.

meanings.definition: A sudden movement of throwing something upward.
meanings.sent1: The upflinging of the ball caught everyone's attention.
meanings.sent2: The upflinging of the coin into the fountain made a wish.
meanings.sent3: The upflinging of the toast caused laughter at the breakfast table.
meanings.sent4: The upflinging of the bouquet at the wedding was a joyful moment.
meanings.sent5: The upflinging of the hat in celebration showed his excitement.
